channel.title: Using Pictures in Delphi?
channel.description:
Basically I have some pictures in a folder, which is in the folder with the rest of the programs files.
\PSR(I have all the files for the program here)\Pictures\rock up.bmp " "\paper up.bmp " "\scissors up.bmp " " \rock down.bmp etc
I have If paperradiobtn.Checked = True then P_Choice := 1;
(here I want to load a picture in the image called playerpic)
I have been searching for a while and I can't figure out how to do this.
All I found was playerpic.Picture.LoadFromFile(Pictures\paper up.bmp);
Which doesn't compile, and I don't know if it's the right method anyway.
Is there anybody who is not incompetent with pascal like myself and knows this?

item.title: Using Pictures in Delphi?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

[quote="_cake, post:4, topic:154551"][quote author=Original Daniel link=topic=211120.msg1847164#msg1847164 date=1193475101]
I am using delphi 7 SE
[/quote]
Then you’re using an Object-Oriented version of Pascal.[/quote]

Ok, but how do I use pictures?

EDIT: Never mind I got it.

Read full topic

item.title: Using Pictures in Delphi?
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

Basically I have some pictures in a folder, which is in the folder with the rest of the programs files.

\PSR(I have all the files for the program here)\Pictures\rock up.bmp
" "\paper up.bmp
" "\scissors up.bmp
" " \rock down.bmp etc

I have
If paperradiobtn.Checked = True then
P_Choice := 1;

(here I want to load a picture in the image called playerpic)

I have been searching for a while and I can’t figure out how to do this.

All I found was
playerpic.Picture.LoadFromFile(Pictures\paper up.bmp);

Which doesn’t compile, and I don’t know if it’s the right method anyway.

Is there anybody who is not incompetent with pascal like myself and knows this?

Read full topic
